text:
(1)
Union Square West, north from and including the S.W. corner of 15th Street, to and including Broadway. Also shown is 17th Street (east), south from and including Broadway, to but not including Fourth Ave.
June 2, 1904.
Brown Brothers.

(2)
The same, showing open street cars on the Broadway Line.
About 1904.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Manhattan: Union Square (West) - 15th Street - Broadway.

text:
Union Square (Park): The James fountain that stands on the westerly side (Union Square West) at about 15th Street. In the background are the buildings that border the easterly margin, Union Square East, actually a continuation of Fourth Avenue. East 16th Street is behind the figures.

1905

George L. Balgue, photo
title: Manhattan: Union Square - [Union Square Park] - The James Fountain.

text:
(1)
Union Square West, north from but not including 15th, to and including 16th Streets.
July 7, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A view, from a different angle of buildings, being demolished.
July 7, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Union Square (West) - Between 15th and 16th Streets.

text:
(1)
Union Sguare West, north from but not including 15th Street. Also shown is 16th Street, north side, west from and including Union Square West, and Broadway, west side, north from and including 17th
Street, to and including 18th Street.
October 30, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same view, at a later date, showing part of the Park completed, taken from the New York Edison Building at No. 4 Irving Place.
September 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Union Square (West) - 15th Street.

text:
Union Square West, from and including 15th Street, to and including 16th Street. Also shown is 15th Street, north side, west from and including Union Square West. Also shown is 16th Street, north side, west from and including Union Square West, to but not including Fifth Ave.

October 30, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

The same view, from a different angle, two years later.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Union Square (West) - Between 15th and 16th Streets.

text:
Union Square West, from and including 15th Street, to and including 16th Street. Also shown is 15th Street, north side, west from and including Union Square West. Also shown is 16th Street, north side, west from and including Union Square West, to but not including Fifth Ave.

title: Manhattan: Union Square (West) - Between 15th and 16th Streets.

text:
Union Square West, north from East 15th Street, showing removal of the Broadway streetcar tracks by the Works Progress Administration. Union Square Park is to the right extending to 17th Street. Above that point this thoroughfare regains its proper identity. The white building at the N. E. corner there is occupied by Butler Brothers. Overhead appears the Metropolitan Life Insurance Co. tower.
View 2 is photographed from 16th Street while No. 3 is closer to 17th Street, the three collectively being progressive.

June 10, 1937
Views 1,2,3

Works Progress Administration
Five Boroughs Project
title: Manhattan: Union Square (West) - 15th Street (East) - [Union Square Park.]
